title: Definition of BIOMEDICAL
description: of or relating to biomedicine; of, relating to, or involving biological, medical, and physical science... See the full definition
cleaned_text: biomedical [adjective](/dictionary/adjective) bio·med·i·cal [b--me-di-kl](/dictionary/biomedical?pronunciation&lang=en_us&dir=b&file=biomed01) 1 2 : of, relating to, or involving biological, medical, and physical science Example Sentences Recent Examples on the Web Henninger points to integrative medicine, which takes a holistic approach that embraces both biomedical and alternative solutions, as a successful way to improve digestive health. —Mary Holland, Robb Report, 27 Aug. 2023 James Zou, an assistant professor of biomedical data science at Stanford University who was not involved in the research, said that Ali's study is the first he's seen that uses ChatGPT to make medical consent forms more accessible. —Maggie Scales, BostonGlobe.com, 23 Aug. 2023 The program allows underrepresented students interested in biomedical careers the opportunity to learn in a lab and conduct cancer research. —Saleen Martin, USA TODAY, 13 Aug. 2023 Still, the fisheries commission in May approved new best management practices for the biomedical industry's harvesting and handling of the crabs. —Patrick Whittle, Fortune, 31 July 2023 The video begins with the female chimp, who spent her early years in a biomedical research laboratory in New York, hesitantly looking outside from the doorway. —Kimberlee Speakman, Peoplemag, 28 June 2023 Warwick, 27, a construction manager from Nashville, Tenn. Xavier, 27, a biomedical scientist from Carrboro, N.C. —Ben Flanagan | Bflanagan@al.com, al, 26 June 2023 Harvard University received $200 million from the Blavatnik Family Foundation to accelerate biomedical research towards therapies. —Roopa Ramamoorthi, STAT, 11 Aug. 2023 The $480 million Ryan donation, for example, also includes gifts to fund biomedical, economics and business research at Northwestern. —Robert Channick, Chicago Tribune, 11 July 2023 [See More](javascript:void(0)) These examples are programmatically compiled from various online sources to illustrate current usage of the word 'biomedical.'
